      • valueMapper

        public ValueMapper<Object> valueMapper()
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Returns the value mapper of this context.

        This method is always safe to call, there should always be a value mapper associated with the context.

        Specified by:

      • internalTransaction

        public InternalTransaction internalTransaction()
                                        throws ProcedureException
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Returns the internal transaction of this context

        If no transaction has been associated with this context this method will throw a ProcedureException

        Specified by:
        internalTransaction in interface Context
        Returns:
        the internal transaction of this context
        Throws:
        ProcedureException - if no transaction has been associated with the context

      • internalTransactionOrNull

        public InternalTransaction internalTransactionOrNull()
        Specified by:
        internalTransactionOrNull in interface Context
        Returns:
        The internal transaction of this context or null if no transaction has been associated with the context.
